name: Bilderberg Hotel Jan Luyken

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found this hotel online and booked it after checking the reviews on trip advisor.
reviews.title: Couldn't fault it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked online and got a cheap rate but took advice of the reviews and upgraded to a superior room.
reviews.title: Very pleased with this great boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel replied promptly to our E-mail in perfect English and everything was sorted out with no hassel.
reviews.title: Lovely hamsterjam

reviews.text: The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. We arrived early at 10 am and the room was ready to check in to despite the advised time of 3 pm.
reviews.title: Good for a city hotel

reviews.text: We didn't eat in the hotel or use the spa but we did use the bar a couple of times. The staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. The location is good, just far enough to avoid the noise of the city center but within easy walking distance of the bars, shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Only the One problem!!

likes.liked: — Bad attitude of one member of staff

reviews.text: We stayed here on a mini break and loved it. Lovely modern rooms with a view, great staff and perfect location. Would definately come back again.
reviews.title: marvellous

reviews.text: We stayed at the Bilderberg Jan Luijken Hotel on 17th March this year for the weekend. I have to say that the hotel was out of this world, great for getting away from our stressful careers. We stayed on the top floor and had a good view. The room was compact but really well furnished. The bathroom and room was spotlessly clean and nice and warm. We couldn't have asked for more and was far better than expected. On arriving we ordered a bottle of wine to the room which didn't arrive after half an hour. On calling room service again they couldn't apologise enough and it was in the room within a few minutes followed by even more apologies. The staff were very well presented and very polite. On asking for directions somewhere the waiter spent ages explaining it to us to make sure we didn't get lost but found that the place is really easy to get around anyway.
reviews.title: Best weekend ever
Great little luxury hotel
reviews.text: We ordered breakfast on the first morning to our room which when it arrived we couldn't believe how much there was and could have probably managed with one between us. The food was great and couldn't find any fault at all. It was also on time by the way ! I have to say that probably the best part of our stay was when we had been out for the day, frozen to the bone and tired. We decided to hire the leisure facilities for about an hour and half which consisted of a jaccuzzi, steam room / power body jet shower, sun bed and massage chair (which was quite funny !!), oh and a mini bar. The receptionist will give you a guided tour and show you how everything works for the first time. We also got a discount with a voucher that was in the room but cost around 30 euros for an hour and half. When we had finished in the room we came out really relaxed and red in the face, probably a combination of the steam room, jaccuzzi and the bottle of wine that we finished off between us. (They didn't charge us for it either). Money well spent, so much so that we hired it again the next day and again got discount.
Top tip. Take some music on Cd with you for use in the room which also accepts MP3 format so you don't need loads of discs if you don't want. Theres also a stereo system in the jaccuzzi room.
reviews.title: Good if you get the right rate

reviews.text: All in all it was a great weekend made even better by a great hotel and brilliant staff. We will definately be going back. We would give this place 10/10 and comes highly reccommended.
reviews.title: Great location but tiny room
Great Stay
reviews.text: The Jan Luyken is really close to everything and if you hire bikes you can get around so quickly. We loved it!

When we arrived we were offered an upgrade for 25 Euros per night. We were already paying quite allot for our room, but when we saw the upgrade we took it instantly. The room was huge, the bathroom was huge and we had a balcony- it was perfect! However if we had stayed in the other room I would have been disappointed, as it was really small, there wasn't a bath and it was at the very back of the hotel. So we were lucky to have the upgrade.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.text: The staff were really friendly and informative- but they did include a sneaky charge for there services on our bill... Getting directions from the concierge should be standard and NOT charged for! Also I borrowed an adapter which cost me £9 per day (which they didn't mention when I asked for it).
reviews.title: Wonderful Location
Disappointed
reviews.text: Other then the sneaky charges the hotel was great. I feel sorry for people who end up in the mini rooms. My advise would be to ask for an upgrade!

This was our first trip to Amsterdam and I am pleased to say that the Jan Luyken was perfect for us! The location was great, away from the beaten track, next to a fab shopping street and across the road from the museums!
reviews.title: Very pleasant and convenient hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 5 nights, in room # 510, and were very comfortable, indeed. The feature I noticed first was the gorgeous tile panels just inside the front door. Further in, we could see the bar/cafe with a beautiful white fireplace, that looked very tempting. Each day, new flowers graced the bar, lobby and sitting room, too.
reviews.title: Very Happy at the Jan Luyken

likes.disliked: — the low lighting in the room

reviews.text: We had a bit of a problem checking in because we missed our first night due to a missed connection in Chicago. However, the lovely young lady at the front desk (who took over from her colleague) told us that the reason our reservation wasn't showing, was because we had already been checked in, so that no one could have our room. Needless to say, I was much relieved.
reviews.title: You should stay here.

reviews.text: The elevator to the 5th floor was wide and roomy ( This is almost a novelty for European hotel elevators.!) I was a bit disappointed with the area off of which the rooms were placed, as it looked a bit institutional. Inside our room, however, I was very pleased. We had a very large bathroom, with huge black marble counter. All was spotless. The shower was great, and I enjoyed the hand held shower. Good toiletries were also supplied and replenished each day.
reviews.title: Fantastic Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One reason I did not give the hotel a 5 star rating was because there wasn't much room to put our clothes, etc. I had to move the extra blanket and pillow from the few shelves provided. However, the pillow and soft ,comfortable blanket were much appreciated.
reviews.title: Loved it! A great place to stay.

likes.liked: — Relaxing atmosphere, comfort, friendly & helpful staff, cleanliness, good interior design
likes.disliked: — For the price we paid for the room, there wasn't anything I could fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was set up for a business traveler, and even included a stapler and paper tray, which I converted to my own use for storage other than paper. The other reason I didn't give the hotel a 5 was because of the low lighting in the room, which made it difficult to read.
reviews.title: Top notch hotel

description: Charming Hotel housed in 19th-century townhouses in cultural district, near Leidseplein & museums.
